page.title: 13DUDSBURY CAMP_GUIDING.
page.content: In 1931 the Dorset Girl Guides were allowed to buy the site at Dudsbury from Lord Wimborne for a nominal sum provided the land was kept in regular use by the Girl Guides.Should it not be the case then the land reverts to the estate. Over the years people have bought nearby land in memory of members of their families to enlarge the site. Anne's meadow is an example of this.Buildings on the site have also been added in memory of Guiders etc. There is a modern main hut with excellent facilities recently added for the disabled.Showers,toilets and even a deep freeze are on site for use by Brownies on Pack holidays and Guides either camping in the open or inside the huts. A permanent campfire site is in frequent use by the Guides from all over England who use the site
